lines.text:
[screaming at Alfred Davidson]
Was I doing you any harm? You bloodthirsty buzzard! Was I? Who gave you the right to pass judgement on me? You psalm-singing louse! You'd tear out your own mother's heart, if she didn't agree with you, and call it saving her soul!
Where do you hail from Sadie?
San Francisco.
That's funny - - my best pal married a girl from San Francisco.
What part of San Francisco?
Where they hang out the red lanterns.

[thoughtfully]
Are they happy?
Sure! 'Sfunny but them that kicks the highest often settles down the hardest.

[to Mr. Davidson]
You've got the power to hang me but I've got the power to tell you - HANG ME AND BE DAMNED!

[to his wife, wiping his forehead]
That girl is possessed of devils!

Pago Pago - in the sultry South Seas - where there is no need for bed clothes - yet the rain comes down in sheets... and a detachment of U.S. Marines spend weary months of exile from white men - and white women.
The knife of reform is the only hope of a sin-sick world.
A righteous man will not hesitate to denounce evil.
Tolerance is such a splendid virtue it's a pity so few of us have it.
Smile, Bozo, smile, for no matter how tough it is today it's bound to be worse tomorrow.
Ameena, a typical South Sea beauty - not lazy - just born tired.
Ever hear the one about the farmer's daughter?
Ever hear the one about the man who was near-sighted?
The morals of the island are pretty bad, but I've made the governor understand that things have got to be cleaned up.
That's the brazen woman who attracted so much attention on the boat.
I have it - that girl is from the disreputable district of San Francisco!
That's very unfair - the girl has a job in Apia - you're jumping at conclusions!
I'm never mistaken - I know what she is and why she is here - to carry on her shameful trade!
Mind your own business! And don't you know better than to bust into a lady's boodwar!
I refuse to have this house turned into a brothel!
Get outta here you big bully, or I'll sic my army on you!
I know why you are here, Sadie Thompson, and I won't have it!
Scarlet woman!
Are you familiar with the whereabouts of the rest room?
How about it, Handsome? Got a girl?
Thanks for being so sociable. That bunch in there act like I'm Mrs. Halitosis.
Gee, Handsome, you're a peach to worry about me.
I can see you're no reformer - you ain't afraid to smile.
No - just a tourist...
I've been talking to the natives - they're so depraved I actually have to teach them what sin is.
I understand you're from San Francisco - what did you do there?
I had a singing job. My voice ain't so bad if you don't listen too hard.
Why did you leave?
My pipes got a little rusty.
Sadie Thompson, you are an evil woman!
Kneel, Sadie Thompson, kneel and repent!
Let go of me, you mealy-mouthed hypocrite!
That guy Davidson ain't human - he's deep and he's creepy - I'm going to need friends soon, Handsome.
Davidson can't send me back to 'Frisco can he?
Don't let him buffalo you, Sadie - that heel couldn't even send regrets.
Where is your mercy? You don't know what I've suffered - you don't care - and you call yourself a Christian!
Where's Davidson?
He went down to the beach to make the natives quit dancing.
Where's Sadie?
Davidson's got her cuckoo - she's been praying steady for three days.
Forget the past, Sadie, and think of the future - us two, shoulder to shoulder - facing life together!
It's the only way, Handsome. I'm - I'm different, now...
No, Sadie! This old hyena's got you so hypnotized it's like you're doped!
Mr. Davidson hasn't slept well for three nights, on account of those terrible dreams he has about Miss Thompson.
Sadie, what are you doing here?
I was afraid to stay in my room - I got to seeing things in the dark.
I, too, have been seeing things in the dark - flaming-hot eyes - Aphrodite - Judas!
What other sacrifice could I offer?
Turn off that phonograph, Sadie - something's happened.
Darned right something's happened - you men are all alike - pigs - PIGS! Nothing personal in that last remark, old pardner.
I guess I'm sorry for everybody in the world - Life is a quaint present from somebody.
Where you going now?
I'm on my way - don't know where but I guess I'll get there.
I'd wait a million years for you!
